This document outlines the planned features and improvements for the Premier League Match Predictor.

## üéØ Vision

To create the most accurate and user-friendly Premier League match prediction platform, powered by cutting-edge machine learning and delivered through an exceptional user experience.

---

## ‚úÖ Completed (v1.0.0)

### Core Features
- [x] Django REST API backend
- [x] Next.js frontend with TypeScript
- [x] PostgreSQL database integration
- [x] Random Forest ML model
- [x] Match prediction API
- [x] Team statistics dashboard
- [x] Model performance tracking
- [x] Docker deployment support
- [x] CSV data import
- [x] Responsive UI design

## üöÄ Version 1.1.0 (Q1 2026)

### Machine Learning Enhancements
- [ ] **XGBoost Model Integration**
  - Implement XGBoost algorithm
  - A/B test against Random Forest
  - Model ensemble support
  - Priority: High

- [ ] **Neural Network Model**
  - LSTM for time-series analysis
  - Deep learning predictions
  - GPU acceleration support
  - Priority: Medium

- [ ] **Feature Engineering**
  - Player-level statistics
  - Weather data integration
  - Injury reports
  - Manager influence metrics
  - Priority: High

### UI/UX Improvements
- [ ] **Dark Mode**
  - Toggle between light/dark themes
  - System preference detection
  - Persistent user preference
  - Priority: Medium

- [ ] **Enhanced Visualizations**
  - Interactive charts (Chart.js/D3)
  - Historical trend analysis
  - Head-to-head comparison graphs
  - Priority: High

- [ ] **Progressive Web App**
  - Offline support
  - Install prompt
  - Push notifications
  - Priority: Low

  - Priority: Medium

- [ ] **Historical Data Expansion**

## üîß Version 1.3.0 (Q3 2026)

- [ ] **Microservices Architecture**

  - Priority: Low

- [ ] **GraphQL API**

  - Priority: Low
